subSections.title: Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|むな}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=むな}}. Possibly the original form of ''mune'' below.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Cognate with {{m|ja|棟|tr=muna||main roofline, roof ridge}}, from the underlying idea of ''central or main portion''.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Possibly also cognate with {{m|ja|空}}, {{m|ja|虚|tr=muna||emptiness, void}}, from the idea of ''cavity''.

Seldom used in isolation even in {{etyl|ojp|-}}. Only found as the first element of compounds in modern Japanese.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
subSections.text:
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|胸%当て|むな%あて}}: a [[bib]]: a [[cloth]] covering the [[chest]] to protect from dirt or food
* {{ja-r|胸%当て錐|むな%あてぎり}}: a [[breast]] [[drill]], [[gimlet]], or [[awl]], with a flat end for pushing with the [[chest]]
* {{ja-r|胸%板|むな%いた}}: “chest board” → the flat area of the chest; a part of the [[breastplate]] in traditional Japanese [[armor]]
* {{ja-r|胸%繋|むな%がい|rom=-}}, {{ja-r|鞅|むながい}}: part of [[riding]] [[tack]], a [[cord]] or [[strap]] running around the [[chest]] and through the {{m|ja|四緒手|tr=shiode||tie-downs}} on the front of the saddle
* {{ja-r|鞅|むなかき}}: older form of ''munagai'' above
* {{ja-r|胸 金%物|むな かな%もの}}: [[metal]] [[fitting]]s on the {{m|ja|胸板|tr=munaita||breastplate}}
* {{ja-r|胸 勘%定|むな かん%じょう}}: [[thinking]] in one's [[head]] to [[figure out|figure something out]] before doing it
* {{ja-r|胸 糞|むな くそ}}: “chest shit” → a [[bad]] [[feeling]], a strong [[dislike]]
* {{ja-r|胸%倉|むな%ぐら|rom=-}}, {{ja-r|胸%座|むな%ぐら}}: the area where the [[collar]] of a [[kimono]] or other [[robe]] [[overlap]]s in front
* {{ja-r|胸%苦しい|むな%ぐるし.い}}: a feeling of [[uncomfortable]] [[pressure]] in the chest, as when [[anxious]] or [[distressed]]
* {{ja-r|胸%黒|むな%ぐろ}}: “black breast” → ''[[Pluvialis fulva]]'', the {{vern|Pacific golden plover}}
* {{ja-r|胸%気|むな%け}}: [[unpleasant]] and [[upsetting]]
* {{ja-r|胸%毛|むな%げ}}: [[chest hair]]
* {{ja-r|胸 先|むな さき}}: the [[solar plexus]], the area just below the [[sternum]]
* {{ja-r|胸 騒ぎ|むな さわぎ}}: “chest noise” → [[uneasiness]], [[foreboding]]
* {{ja-r|胸%算|むな%ざん}}: [[thinking]] in one's [[head]] to [[figure out|figure something out]] before doing it
* {{ja-r|胸%算%用|むな%ざん%よう}}: [[thinking]] in one's [[head]] to [[figure out|figure something out]] before doing it
* {{ja-r|胸 簾|むな すだれ}}: “chest screen” → the [[rib]]s
* {{ja-r|胸 底|むな そこ}}: the [[bottom]] of one's [[heart]], one's [[innermost]] [[thought]]s
* {{ja-r|胸%高|むな%だか}}: [[tying]] one's {{m|ja|帯|tr=obi||sash}} high on one's chest instead of at the waist
* {{ja-r|胸%乳|むな%ち}}: [[breast]], [[boob]]
* {{ja-r|胸%突き|むな%つき}}: a [[steep]] [[slope]], as on a [[hill]] or [[mountain]]
* {{ja-r|胸%突き 八%丁|むな%つき はっ%ちょう}}: a very [[steep]] [[street]] or [[path]]; the last hard [[push]] before reaching a [[goal]]
* {{ja-r|胸%尽くし|むな%づくし}}: the [[bottom]] of the [[chest]], the area just below the [[sternum]]
* {{ja-r|胸%積り|むな%づもり}}: [[thinking]] in one's [[head]] to [[figure out|figure something out]] before doing it
* {{ja-r|胸づわらし|むなづわらし}}: very [[sad]] or [[uneasy]] in a way that makes one's chest [[constrict]]
* {{ja-r|胸 鬚|むな ひげ}}: “chest beard” → [[chest hair]]
* {{ja-r|胸 紐|むな ひも}}: a [[cord]] across the [[chest]] for holding a [[kimono]] or [[haori]] closed
* {{ja-r|胸%鰭|むな%びれ}}: “chest fin” → [[pectoral fin]]
* {{ja-r|胸%骨|むな%ぼね}}: the [[breastbone]], the [[sternum]]
* {{ja-r|胸%元|むな%もと|rom=-}}, {{ja-r|胸%許|むな%もと}}: the [[chest]]; the area in front of the chest
* {{ja-r|胸%焼け|むな%やけ}}: [[heartburn]] {{qualifier|indigestion}}
* {{ja-r|胸%分く|むな%わく}}: to push through bushes or scrub using one's chest, to [[bushwhack]]
* {{ja-r|胸%分け|むな%わけ}}: pushing through bushes or scrub using one's chest, [[bushwhacking]]; the [[breadth]] of the chest
{{der-bottom}}

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|むね|yomi=k}}
Sound shift from ''muna'' above, from the fusion of ''muna'' with the emphatic nominal particle {{m|ja|い|tr=i}}: {{IPAchar|/muna i/}} → {{IPAchar|/mune/}}, from {{inh|ja|jpx-pro|*munay}}. Similar to the phonetic process observed in the shift from {{m|ja|神|tr=kamu||spirit, god|pos=older form used in compounds}} to {{m|ja|神|tr=kami|pos=newer form, used as a standalone noun}}.

Alternatively, may be a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=むね|身|tr1=mu|t1=body|根|tr2=ne|t2=root}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Cognate with {{m|ja|棟|tr=mune||main roofline, roof ridge}} and {{m|ja|宗}}, {{m|ja|旨|tr=mune||gist, main idea, primary part}}, from the underlying idea of ''central or main portion''.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Notably, {{m|ja|棟}} and {{m|ja|宗}} also have an older reading ''muna'' that is only used in compounds (for {{m|ja|宗}}, possibly only in place names). Meanwhile, {{m|ja|旨|tr=mune}} appears later in the textual record (in the ''[[w:Uji_Shūi_Monogatari|Uji Shūi Monogatari]]'' of the early 1200s), and this reading is used as a standalone noun rather than in compounds. This is consistent with other nouns that have paired vowel forms, and suggests that ''muna'' is probably the original form, and that the compound derivation is a [[folk etymology]].
